definitions: To make something accessible or available.
To start to talk more freely about one's feelings or personal matters.
To create new opportunities or possibilities.
To begin to operate or become active.
To make a way through something by removing obstacles.
examples: They decided to open up a new branch in the city.
She found it hard to open up about her past.
The new policy will open up jobs for many.
The store will open up at 9 AM.
The engineers worked to open up the blocked road.
